ABOUT.ME: Hi, I’m Daniel! I’ve been working in web development for over three and a half years, starting with my apprenticeship. I’m passionate about combining the logic of computer science with the creativity of design, building websites and applications that are not only functional but also visually engaging.
ABOUT.LOCATION: I’m based in Munich, but I thrive in flexible environments. Remote work fits me perfectly, and I’m open to relocating for the right opportunity.
ABOUT.UP_2_DATE: I approach new technologies, tools, and frameworks with curiosity and enthusiasm. For me, learning isn’t just about keeping up it’s a chance to innovate, bring fresh ideas to my work, and continually push the boundaries of what I can create.
ABOUT.COGNITION: I tackle challenges with a mix of analytical thinking, creativity, and persistence. I love experimenting to find elegant, efficient solutions that have a meaningful impact. Coding for me is more than getting things done it’s about crafting solutions that last.

SKILLS.INFO: I’ve worked with a wide range of front-end and back-end technologies, including Angular, TypeScript, Firebase, Docker, Java, PHP, and SQL. I adapt quickly to new technologies, continuously refine my skills and workflow, and treat every project as an opportunity to learn, grow, and stay ahead in the fast-moving world of web development, delivering efficient, scalable, and engaging solutions.
SKILLS.CONTACT: Feel free to contact me. I look forward to expanding on my previous knowledge.
SKILLS.INTERESTS: I have a special interest in learning

PORTFOLIO.EXPLORE:
Explore a selection of my work here - Interact with
projects to see my skills in action.

PROJECTS.POK_DEX_DESC: JavaScript-based project with a connection to the RESTful Pokémon API.
PROJECTS.JOIN_DESC: Task manager inspired by the Kanban System. Create and organize tasks using drag and drop functions, assign users and categories.
PROJECTS.SHARKIE_DESC: Underwater platformer based on object-oriented approach. Help Sharkie to find coins and bubbles to fight against the killer whale.
PROJECTS.DA_BUBBLE_DESC: This App is a Slack Clone App. It revolutionizes team communication and collaboration with its intuitive interface, real-time messaging, and robust channel organization.

COLLEAGUES.SAY: What my colleagues say about me
COLLEAGUES.COL_1_TEXT: Working with him was a great experience. He is highly knowledgeable, quick to learn, and a true team player. I would gladly collaborate with him again.
COLLEAGUES.COL_2: Philip - IT Specialist in Application Development
COLLEAGUES.COL_2_TEXT: He was a year younger in the program, and I had the opportunity to teach him various skills. He was eager to learn, quickly absorbed new knowledge, and approached every task with curiosity and enthusiasm.
COLLEAGUES.COL_3_TEXT: I identified him as a promising candidate for our Apprenticeship. During our time together, he showed great enthusiasm and dedication, eagerly learning SEO from me and quickly applying his new skills. His curiosity and motivation made him truly stand out.
COLLEAGUES.COL_4_TEXT: I first met him during his internship at my workplace and immediately recognized his potential in software development. I supported him in finding a suitable apprenticeship position, and he consistently demonstrated motivation, curiosity, and a strong willingness to learn.
COLLEAGUES.COL_5_TEXT: I had the pleasure of mentoring him in frontend development during his apprenticeship. While work responsibilities eventually limited my teaching time, I was consistently impressed by his dedication, curiosity, and ability to learn quickly. I would have loved to continue guiding him, as he showed great potential and enthusiasm.

CONTACT.INFO: I build websites and applications that are functional, engaging, and user-friendly. I’m open to remote work and collaborations, bringing technical expertise, creativity, and curiosity to every project.
CONTACT.VALUE: I’d love to add real value to your team or idea!

PRIVACY.TITLE: Privacy Policy
PRIVACY.INTRODUCTION: I respect your privacy and take the protection of your personal data seriously. This Privacy Policy explains how I handle information when you visit and use Portfolio (my personal website).
PRIVACY.INFO_COLLECT: I do not actively collect, process, or store personal data of visitors. However, certain technical information (such as IP address, browser type, and general usage data) may be automatically collected by your browser or my hosting provider to ensure the basic functionality and security of the website.
PRIVACY.USE_INFO: Any automatically collected information is used solely to maintain and improve the performance, functionality, and security of Portfolio. I do not use your data for marketing, profiling, or commercial purposes.
PRIVACY.COOKIES: Portfolio itself does not use cookies. However, third-party services or the hosting provider may rely on cookies for technical operation. You can manage or block cookies at any time via your browser settings.
PRIVACY.THIRD_PARTY: This website may contain links to external websites. I am not responsible for the privacy practices or content of those external services. Visiting such sites is at your own discretion.
PRIVACY.DATA_SECURITY: I take reasonable measures to protect your information. However, as with any online service, I cannot guarantee complete protection against all risks. Please use this website with that understanding.
PRIVACY.YOUR_RIGHTS: As a visitor, you have the right to request information about any personal data that may have been collected, as well as to request its correction or deletion where applicable. Since Portfolio does not intentionally store personal data, such requests may be limited in scope.
PRIVACY.CHANGES: I may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in legal requirements or technical setup. Updates will be published on this page.
PRIVACY.CONTACT: For any questions regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact me at webmaster@daniel-tran.com.
